names.pharmaceuticalLatin: Fructus Setariae Germinatus Fructus Oryzae Germinatus

action.primary: Reduces Food Stagnation, strengthens and opens the Stomach and harmonizes the Center

indications: Poor digestion due to Stagnation and accumulation of undigested starchy foods.
Weak digestion and loss of appetite associated with Spleen Deficiency

action.primary: Strengthens the Spleen and encourages the appetite

contraindications: Long-term use may injure the Kidneys (Gu Ya).

useCases: Reduced appetite and focal distention of the chest and abdomen due to Food Stagnation
Poor digestion due to Spleen and Stomach Deficiencies
Poor digestion food with decreased food intake and diarrhea from Spleen and Stomach Deficiencies

notes: Su Ya is sold in Southern China as Germinated Rice Gu Ya due to their similarity of functions.
This herb gently reduces and transforms Food Stagnation due to accumulation of grains and starches.
When applied to the skin as a paste, it makes the skin glossy.

Both Su Ya and Massa Medicata Fermentata #{ShenQu} Shen Qu reduce Food Stagnation. Su (Gu) Ya is more harmonious, gentle and tonifying. It strengthens the Spleen and tonifies Qi. It is preferred when the Spleen and Stomach are weak and unable to properly digest food leading to anorexia.
The digestive action of Gu Ya is more moderate than #{MaiYa} Mai Ya. They are generally prescribed together to enhance the therapeutic effect.
This herb is especially good for retention of grains.

The two most effective herbs to treat Food Stagnation from grains are this herb and Fr. Hordei Germinatus Mai Ya which facilitates digestion and has some Spleen strengthening properties.It is best for treating Cold Food Stagnation with absorption problems. This herb has weaker digestive functions and therefore does not injure the Stomach Qi. It is most effective for Hot Food Stagnation with pronounced Spleen Deficiency.
Unprepared Millet/Rice Sprouts Sheng Su/Gu Ya are best for assisting digestion of starches.
Dry-fried Millet/Rice Sprouts Chao Su/Gu Ya, if lightly roasted are almost as good as Sheng Su/Gu Ya at digesting grains and starches.

Distillate of Millet/Rice Sprouts Su/Gu Ya Lu reduces Food Stagnation, strengthens the Spleen, improves appetite harmonizes the Middle, generates Fluids and benefits Qi. It is an excellent beverage as a tea substitute for those with weak Spleen function, as it tonifies and eliminates Food Stagnation.
